reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is clean and spacious. We're early riser and breakfast was ready in the "lobby"/counter by the time we're ready to start our day. The aroma from the coffee is an excellent wake-me up! Ask for a room away from the street if you're a light sleeper (sensitive to noise). Parking is conveniently located inside the property.
reviews.title: Clean and Spacious Room

reviews.text: The rooms are old but clean. The night desk clerk was funny and polite. From the outside I expected all the worst but to my surprise it was definately more that I expected. Don't get me wrong its nothing special or a place that I would make plans to go to specifically, but believe me I have stayed at much worse.
reviews.title: Got stranded and it was my only option, but to my surprise I was not dissapointed.

reviews.text: I traveled to the Olympic Peninsula for Spring Break this year and spent two nights at the Royal Victorian Motel in Port Angeles. If you are planning on staying in this town, make sure to book a room at the Royal Victorian. KC and Ed (the folks that run the place) are both extremely nice and make sure to help you out with whatever you need while you are on vacation. When I got back to the motel after visiting Victoria, BC, I was greeted with a barbeque of streak and potatoes for dinner. I've never had this level of hospitality before. The motel is very clean and well kept for its age. It is also walking distance from the ferry and the downtown shops and restaurants. KC actually gave me a ride to the ferry in the morning. I didn't even need to walk! The Royal Victorian is less expensive than the larger hotel/motel chains, so you'll save yourself some money staying there too. Make this your first stop in town, you won't regret it!
reviews.title: The Royal Victorian gets an A+

reviews.text: Neil Loehlein
reviews.title: Clean, Great Location and Good Service

reviews.text: Portland, OR
reviews.title: Very satisfied
Very nice place to stay
reviews.text: I would recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again in a heart beat. Their rooms are very clean and the hotel staff was very helpful.
reviews.title: Good value, nice place

likes.liked: — Clean, spacious, great location and a great value.

reviews.text: The bathroom is large and it was nice to have a refrig. and microwave in our room.
reviews.title: Always good

reviews.text: Thank you Casey and Ed for making our stay at your motel an enjoyable one.
reviews.title: friendly, remodeled hotel

reviews.text: Wisconsin traveler
reviews.title: Great accidental find.

reviews.text: If I was writing this review based solely on the hotel managers it would be 5/5 stars for sure. From the moment my husband and I checked in we felt welcomed. The Guy manger asked us if we needed any info on the area or dinner ideas. They were having an informal dinner for the guests but we decided to go out to Mexican food instead. The rooms are dated but were clean. It would be nice if the had some newer bed spreads as other reviewers have said. When we checked out we were given some bottled water and cliff bars for our hike. A very nice touch. Please do not judge this place from the parking lot. There is something special out the Royal Victorian. The Managers and their hospitality.
reviews.title: Hotel Managers are wonderful hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While it is an older motel, it is well maintained & the rooms were clean. Nothing fancy, a great place to stop for the night. Very freindly people!
reviews.title: Great stopover!

reviews.text: KC and her staff were personable and went out of their way to make our short stay great. The rooms were spotless and smelled great. Towels were even soft! The building is an older building about 3 blocks from the Ferry terminal. I was able to leave my car in their parking lot during my time in Victoria.
reviews.title: Great Staff - Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you travelers for the reviews on this site! If it wasn't for TripAdvisor, I'd be sleeping in my car. My husband and I are on a cross country trip and I have used the Tripadvisor reviews for all our hotel stays. I have to admit I am picky and like a clean room above all. Whenwe pulled into this motel it remembered what others had said. There is no fancy lobby, I fact no lobby at all, just a small room. We were checked in quickly and shown to our room by someone filling in for the owner. While the motel and rooms are old, the furniture and beds and spreads are new. The room was spotless. Shortly the owner came in to see if everything was ok. She brought us all kinds of amenities such as toothpaste, razors, etc . When we asked her about some of the things to see in Olympic National Park, she suggested several places for us visit and offered us extra towels if we wanted to go to the hot springs. Staying at this motel is like staying with old friends. You can't do better.
reviews.title: TripAdvisor, you were right again !

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Royal Victorian Motel for ten years both on business with my company, American Photo Tours, and on family trips to Olympic National Park and across the Strait to Victoria, British Columbia. This is an exceptional family owned and operated business, and the folks who run it go out of their way to make sure you are well cared for and that everyhting is to your satisfaction. The rooms all have individual character and are spotless clean and well appointed. The very fact that it is not a chain property is one of its best features. I tried many other motels in Port Angeles before discovering the Royal Victorian, and from experience can say there are simply no other well located, impeccably maintained and very economical properties that can compare with this wonderful property. I salute this great family for all their dedicated effort in providing such a great home away from home.
reviews.title: Best Overall Motel in Port Angeles!

reviews.text: This hotel is a classic post-war "motor court" style, with a L-shaped building around a parking lot and exterior corridors. However, unlike many hotels of similar age that have been forced to compete with larger chains, it is not at all seedy or dirty, so don't be turned off by the appearance. The rooms still have their original layout, but with modern conveniences like fridge, microwave, etc. It had clearly been repainted quite recently. The bathroom had an older tub, and the toilet even had one of those "sanitized for your protection" wrappers -- when was the last time you saw one of those? The towels were surprisingly soft -- softer than the sandpaper at a large chain hotel I recently stayed at. The bed was comfortable and the traffic noise wasn't really noticeable. I felt very safe, even with an exterior corridor as the metal door was quite solid and there were security cameras at each end of the corridor. The owner was very nice and friendly, providing some trial-size toiletries and bottled water on check in. Breakfast was fruit, muffins and other pastries. Overall a great value for the price!
reviews.title: Clean, friendly, great value
Yaniv
reviews.text: Comfortable room, clean reasonable breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good value for money
reviews.title: Older motel close to ferry terminal
Exceeded Expectations
reviews.text: The only disadvantage was a leaking water at the bathroom
Owner was very friendly and eager to help
reviews.title: Great Customer Service and Hospitality!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners are super friendly and helpful. The property is older and some things are a bit creaky, but the price is terrific, and the owners bend over backward to make sure you're satisfied. They gave us great travel suggestions for our trip around the peninsula, as well as extra breakfast items for a snack on the road.
reviews.title: Delightful stay
What a surprise!
reviews.text: We almost turned around in the parking lot. I'm so glad we didn't! While the outside looked less than appealing and the room decor was very outdated, the room was very clean, large and quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the price was great.

Went to Port Angeles for a concert and didn't feel like coming back home--looked at several places with kid & dog--this was friendly to both--comfy beds-quiet locale (even near 1010 and really nice people
reviews.title: stuck in PA without a bed?

reviews.text: Ended up renting several rooms for a Saturday night. The rooms were clean and well maintained even though it is an older property. You can tell the proprietors take care to make every accommodation possible. If you need a place to crash for the night at a decent price I would definitely stay here. It's within walking distance of the downtown area and easy to find.
reviews.title: Great hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel deal! I stayed in a second floor room which was old but clean and quiet. A continental breakfast is included. The proprietors were very friendly and full of suggestions for hiking and restaurants. You won't find this value anywhere else.
reviews.title: Very clean, great deal

reviews.text: This motel is located next to a busy road, but if you ask for a room away from the front, there is minimal noise from the traffic. The location is very convenient, within walking distance to several restaurants. The room we stayed in (two queens, second floor) was spotlessly clean. The beds were super comfortable (had been recently replaced. The room was big and had everything we needed.
reviews.title: Great stay for the price!

reviews.text: The managers were very friendly and obviously interested in making your stay a pleasant one.
reviews.title: Economy lodging in a high cost tourist town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recomment the Royal Victorian in Port Angeles.
reviews.title: An amazing manager

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Motel was clean, well worth the money. An adequate breakfast that you picked up
reviews.title: Nice inexpensive stay
Utilitarian, clean, very friendly
reviews.text: in the motel office and took to your room. Biggest complaint was that room 21

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, quiet, comfortable and very reasonably priced.....Manager KC was wonderful and helpful in every way possible. The fresh donuts in the morning were obscenely delicious.
reviews.title: Total Satisfaction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was kept very clean (especially considering it's age). The owners were very nice. However, I experienced some very scary and disturbing things during my stay. Has anyone else had something like this happen while visiting there? I had never encountered anything paranormal until that night. One of the doors kept on opening by itself and it was very cold in that area of the room (colder than outside). My boyfriend awoke in the middle of the night to me screaming in terror. I was having a nightmare and had jumped out of bed and pushed myself against the wall screaming, "Oh my God!, oh my God!" over and over. Oddly enough, I was pressed against the piping hot furnace and didn't wake. When I came to I explained that I had felt like I was being attacked by something evil and had walked right into a trap. I was soaking wet with sweat and my boyfriend said he thought I was dying by my behavior. The room felt like a sauna. Someone had turned the thermostat up to 90...and it wasn't me or my boyfriend. The door that we had shut before getting in bed was swung open and the air around it was ice cold. I have never had night terrors or reacted so violently to anything in my life. I've tried to research if something bad happened there or if someone died in the vicinity. If anyone has information on past events at that hotel I would be very interested in hearing about them. I have to think that something similar has happened to someone else in the past.
reviews.title: Friendly owners, clean room,....and PARANORMAL ACTIVITY

reviews.text: My favorite thing about this hotel was KC herself. She is the sweetest lady ever and gave us craisins and water plus other treasure for our stay which was only $45 plus tax. The outside was typical for a motel, nothing fancy but a cheerful yellow building. This isn't the ritz but you get much more than you pay for!
reviews.title: What a pleasant stay!

reviews.text: I have stayed at The Royal Victorian Motel each and every time I pass through Port Angeles, Washington. The Motel provides Clean, Comfortable Accomodation at an Affordable Rate. The Proprietors KC and Ed bend over backwards to ensure their guests have a pleasant and enjoyable stay. It's not the newest or most modern building, but I have no problem recommending this establishment to any of my friends or family. Give them a try, and see for yourself! Their website is www.royalvictorian.net
reviews.title: Your search is over! This is where you want to stay.

reviews.text: I was a business traveler staying for two weeks, booked there by my company. The managers there were absolutely the nicest of any I have ever encountered. My room was large and comfortable and secluded from any noise. The surrounding buildings give the wrong impression, this is a lovely place. I was away from home on a holiday and the managers had me and several other guests for dinner!! I was a woman traveling alone and I felt very safe. Very close to the ferry to BC and many other attractions. You won't regret staying here.
reviews.title: Amazing!!! You must stay here!!

reviews.text: We were underwhelmed at first; this place is basically a politely managed Mom and Pop with the ambience and decor of a Super 8 motel. It is very well maintained , roomy and super clean with new mattresses and furniture. It was the quietest place I ever slept. But the motel light came in because the blinds/curtain didn't fully filter out the light. The bed was so super comfy, but the pillow was a rock ( my Mom agreed). The AC was way too cold; and since our blanket was thin, we slept without it and then were too hot. I woke up crabby. But as we were on the way to the BC Ferry...the motel owners saved us money and trouble with 1) a very nice continental breakfast of muffins, bananas, oatmeal, coffee, cocoa, pastries, trail mix ...etc. 2) They informed us of a free shuttlebus to our ferry and called it for us. 3) They invited us to leave our car in their lot for the day so we didn't need to pay for parking in the ferry lot. 4) As we were getting on the bus the lady owner ran out to the van with free bottled water for everyone. The shuttle van driver went on and on about how nice these motel owners are and we all agreed. To go all out for transient guests of one night is unusual. I will forgive them the bad pillow and bright room and say Yes! stay here! Hook a bedspread up over the window and ask for an extra blanket, a different pillow and crank up your a.c. Orger pizza from Gordy's down the street...they deliver and it was good. Stay with kind people. You will not regret it.
reviews.title: A good choice for one night, such nice owners. BYO pillow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an older motel, but a good value for this town. I knew to ask for a quiet room towards the back. We were given a double queen, 2 bedroom suite, for the price of a single queen! There were 2 tv's, a table and chairs, and a micro and fridge. It was clean, but could use some touch-up paint, but very minor. The bed was rather firm and the pillows were too firm! Small towels, but soft.
reviews.title: As recommended by others here on Tripadvisor!

reviews.text: The owners were very accomodating and helpful! Very acceptable budget property.
reviews.title: Clean & Comfy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pleasant owners, good location, clean room, comfy bed. Liked being on second floor - suggest you ask for that if your bag isn't heavy. For a picnic, stop by Safeways three blocks away to buy food. Wifi is great and free! Would stay here again
reviews.title: Charming roadside motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good: The hostessis a sweetheart. She'll go out of her way to make you comfortable and direct you to local places of interest. The room, which was tucked well into the back of the motel, was surprisingly quiet (mostly due to it's proximity to the street). The bed was surprisingly comfortable. The room for the most part was clean and the location is great for exploring Port Angeles and ONP. It's considerably cheaper than other motels in the area.
reviews.title: very spacious, clean, comfy, close to everything

reviews.text: We found the Royal Victorian serviceable for our needs. We just needed a base for a night, and they provided that. It seems like a nice family business run by discreet proselytizers. I thought it was a touch expensive but it looked like one of the better motels in town. The dog smell in the office was overpowering though. Tip: Try the Blue Flame BBQ to the east of town off 101, great food!
reviews.title: Clean and practical

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel a few times in the last couple of months and have always enjoyed my stay. The staff at the front desk is extremely friendly and they go out of their way to make sure my stay in Port Angeles is enjoyable. The only true negative I've encountered is the amount of road noise that can be heard if you stay in a room closer to the street. My solution is to simply keep the window closed and to turn on the A/C or fan, which creates a bit of white noise to drown out the passing cars. Yeah, the rooms can be a bit pricey, but the whole city is like this. If you don't have to stay in Port Angeles, then don't. If you do need to stay, then the Royal Victorian is a good choice. It's just a few blocks from the "downtown" shops, beach, and several excellent restuarants.
reviews.title: Mid-range hotel in an overpriced city

likes.liked: — Friendly staff with clean, comfortable rooms

reviews.text: I picked this hotel because of the good reviews, and this is the first time I have been really disappointed. I booked a room with 2 bedrooms, both which were tiny, more like one room with a wall put up inbetween. The room was fairly clean, but very dated, with old linens, stained carpet, and rock-hard beds. The bathroom had numerous holes in the walls, and had been painted over obvious dirt and hair that was not cleaned off. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, but the room was way over-priced ($146 with AAA mid-week) for what should have been maybe $60. All the hotels in Port Angeles were expensive, next time I'll go straight to Victoria.
reviews.title: Big Disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable. We stayed in a very quiet corner room with no road noise, a fridge and micro. The continental breakfast was enough to keep us going for a while each day. The staff here were amazingly friendly and helpful. It's convenient and a good deal--we would stay again!
reviews.title: Clean, friendly, good deal

likes.liked: — Clean and friendly for a great price
likes.disliked: — Not exactly visually appealing from the outside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Royal Victorian doesn't look like much outside--just a small downtown hotel. However, the rooms are clean, well maintained, and very comfortable--and more affordable than most in Port Angeles. Casey and the rest of the staff look after their guests. There is some traffic noise but that seems to be true of most places near the riverfront and ferries.
reviews.title: Don't judge by the exterior

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The manager was exceptionally helpful, friendly, and generous of heart. We paid $89 + tax, and the room we stayed in was newly refurbished with a large tv, small refrigerator, and microwave. The room was clean and the shower pressure was good. The building appeared to have been recently painted. The hotel is located on a busy road. There is some noise. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: good value and nice people
Royal Victorian, A nice place for the money
reviews.text: I just spent 2 nights at the family owned Royal Victorian Motel in Port Angeles, Washington. It is quite old, but has been taken care of over the years. I was traveling alone, am a woman, and was wanting a very secure place to stay. My room had plenty of walking space, the bed was firm, but okay, and the sheets were very clean. The bathroom was neat and tidy, and had excellent water pressure, and little extra shampoo's to take home. It also had a nice microwave and a small fridge with a freezer, and internet access. A pleasant continental breakfast was provided, and the people working there were very nice and friendly. This is a very small motel, with only 20 rooms, all non-smoking, and is in the heart of downtown Port Angeles, so there is a lot of traffic noise all night, but the motel itself was quiet. The whole place could use a paint job, and some upgrades, but for the price, it is an excellent deal. I paid only $59 per night, and even had an extra bedroom, which I used for my bags. The main downfall is the very small parking lot, and I drive a big pickup...hard to park!!! And if you are looking for a view, don't stay here....my view was of the roof and an old builiding next store. Next time I might try the Portside Inn, as it looked a little more up to date, but is a little more expensive.

Great value motel in easy walking distance from restaurants. Could be a little noisy as it is on the main road but we didn't notice - most if not all places will have this issue. Nice breakfast included.
reviews.title: Very clean, very comfortable, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this motel while visiting Olympic National Park for a few days. The hosts were very friendly and gave us good advice on dining options nearby. The room was large, comfortable and clean with all the amenities we needed. I'd definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Friendly motel with all the amenities we needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel is a little old but clean. The owner was very pleasant and willing to give you advise as the best places to visit and eat.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: The motel is about a few miles from the main entrance to the Olympic national park.
reviews.title: Would NOT stay again

reviews.text: Prior to reserving this motel, we did not know it was located right on the main highway. The first night, we slept in the 2-room suite, which was located right next to the road, with windows facing the road. Although we were assured that the noise level would die down, it finally did after about 2 AM and picked up again around 6 AM. It was one of the worst nights spent in a hotel and the next day we requested a different room, willing to go home early if nothing else was available. The room we received was much quieter (towards the back of the hotel), cleaner, and roomier. Breakfast included coffee, bananas, muffins, and small danishes. Overall, we were disappointed.
reviews.title: Clean, large, comfortable room
